author: John Lyons
title: South Korea Sees Olympics More Secure With North Korea in Than Out
text:
PYEONGCHANG, South Korea—When Ken Douglas told his parents he planned to spend part of his honeymoon in this ski resort hosting the 2018 Winter Olympics, they offered to pay the newlyweds’ way to somewhere else. They feared North Korea’s nuclear standoff with the U.S. would escalate around the Games. 

Their worries eased when North Korea in early January announced it would send a delegation to the competition. “If North Korea was planning to do anything, they wouldn’t send all these athletes,” said Mr. Douglas, a 28-year-old... RELATED VIDEO By opening the door to dialogue, Kim Jong Un has turned the world's biggest sporting event into a political weapon. WSJ looks at why the Winter Games are so important to Pyongyang.
